The Fossil Island squirrels are a group of squirrels who help players look after the three hardwood tree patches on Fossil Island. Despite being non-human, players are able to understand them. When asked why, they respond that they are more intelligent than they appear.

Players can pay each squirrel 15 limpwurt roots to watch after their teak trees, and 25 Yanillian hops to watch after their mahogany trees.

Using any item other than acorns on them prompts the response "No thanks. I prefer acorns." Players can use acorns on them to initiate special dialogue, but the acorns will be lost. However, using a dark acorn on them will result in them saying "That Acorn looks nasty, no squirrel in their right mind would eat that!"

Shop[edit | edit source]

The squirrels also sell basic farming tools, which can be accessed by talking to them and asking Can you sell me something? It is not an actual shop and it has no set stock; each item has to be bought individually through the dialogue.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 November 2018
(update)

Gardeners at farming patches now sell plant pots.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • All variants of Fossil Island squirrels had a festive override wearing a santa hat during the 2017, 2018, and 2019 Christmas events.
